resources.string: This app acts as an intermediate step towards opening url links. When you click on a link and choose this app to open it, it will show a dialog with some information about the link. Check the setup screen for the available modules and what they do.
Press the link below to test it:\nhttp://www.google.com/
List of modules: You can enable or disable them, also check its description and configuration.
Can\'t enable the module, missing configuration?
Checks for non-ascii characters like greek letters. This can be used for phishing: googĺe.com vs google.com
Contains the open and share buttons. If a link can be opened with multiple apps, an arrow will be shown to let you choose. \nCan\'t be disabled.

By pressing the redirect button a petition will be made to retrieve that url. If the result is a redirection, the new url will be replaced (can be undo). The url is fetched, but not evaluated, so redirection based on javascript won\'t be detected.
Displays the current url, which can be edited manually.\nCan\'t be disabled.

When this module is enabled you can scan the url using VirusTotal and check the report.\nA personal VirusTotal API key is needed for it to work, you can get one after registering for a free account here: https://www.virustotal.com/gui/join-us.
VirusTotal™ is a trademark of Google, Inc.
None of the %d engines detected the url (as of date %s)
Warning, %d/%d engines detected the url (as of date %s)
Careful! %d/%d engines detected the url (as of date %s)
Can\'t connect to VirusTotal. Make sure you have an active internet connection or try again later.
Can\'t connect to VirusTotal. Make sure the api key is valid or try again later.
